title: Is it worth buying a refurbished MacBook Air M1?
self_text: I've been eyeing a refurbished MacBook Air M1 from Apple Certified Refurbished. It's significantly cheaper than a new M2 model, and the M1 chip still seems incredibly capable based on reviews. My main uses are web browsing, document editing, light photo editing, and streaming videos. I'm hesitant because it's refurbished, even with the certification. Are there typically hidden issues with these? Is the battery life noticeably degraded? Worth saving the money, or should I bite the bullet and get a new one?

title: Is anyone else experiencing insane latency spikes with Comcast Xfinity?
self_text: Lately, my ping has been fluctuating wildly, even during off-peak hours. I'm consistently seeing spikes into the hundreds of milliseconds, even though my download and upload speeds remain stable. I've rebooted my modem multiple times, and contacted support, who insisted everything looked fine on their end. Speedtests show good results, but online games are unplayable. Anyone else experiencing this, and have you found any solutions?

title: Is it okay to connect my Switch dock to an unpowered USB hub?
self_text: I'm short on USB ports on my TV, and I'm wondering if it's alright to plug the Switch dock into an unpowered USB hub to connect controllers and other accessories. I've heard conflicting things about whether this causes issues with charging or connectivity. Will this potentially brick my Switch or cause problems with gameplay?

title: Is it worth switching to Visible Wireless?
self_text: I'm currently with Mint Mobile and my promotional rate expires in January. I've been looking at Visible as an alternative, especially since they now offer nationwide coverage with Verizon. My main concern is data speeds and reliability – I often work remotely and rely on a stable connection. Has anyone made the switch from Mint to Visible recently? Was the performance noticeably different? I'm mainly interested in experiences regarding video calls and general browsing speed.

title: Lost progress in Diablo Immortal
self_text: Been grinding for a week and just realized none of my progress is syncing to the server. Checked my connection, restarted the game, cleared cache, nothing fixes it. Really disheartening to lose a week's worth of effort. Anybody else experiencing this? Any solutions?

title: Is it okay to disconnect a UPS while still powered on?
self_text: I have a CyberPower CP1500AVRLCD UPS. I've been using it for my gaming PC and monitor for a while now. Recently I needed to move the UPS to another room, and I unplugged it from the wall *before* powering off the devices connected to it. Everything seemed fine, but I'm now wondering if I damaged the UPS by doing that. I've read conflicting information online – some say it's okay, others say it can shorten the lifespan of the battery or even damage the unit. Was disconnecting the power cord while the UPS was still running a bad idea? Should I be powering down everything connected to it *first*, then unplugging the UPS?

title: Thinking of switching from Mint Mobile to Visible
self_text: Been with Mint Mobile for about 2 years now, and overall it’s been good, but their customer support is atrocious. Lately I’ve been having consistent data slowdowns, especially during peak hours, and contacting support is a nightmare. Visible seems to have decent coverage in my area (confirmed with friends) and their $25/month plan is tempting. Anyone made the switch recently? Was it a smooth process? Are the data speeds noticeably better? Any hidden downsides I should be aware of?

title: Getting ghosted after initial interview
self_text: I had an initial interview last week with a company and it went really well. The interviewer said they were impressed and would schedule a second interview with the hiring manager within a few days. It's been a week now and I haven't heard anything despite following up twice. Is this a typical rejection or should I assume something unexpected came up on their end? I'm trying not to get discouraged but it's frustrating to be left in the dark.

title: Thinking of switching careers - Data Analyst to Software Engineer
self_text: Hi everyone, I'm currently working as a data analyst with about 2 years of experience. I enjoy the analytical aspects of my job, but I'm increasingly drawn to the creation side of things – building applications and solving problems through coding. I've started learning Python and JavaScript in my spare time and really enjoy it. I'm considering a career switch to software engineering, but I'm hesitant to leave the stability of my current role. I'm wondering if anyone has made a similar transition, and what their experience was like? What resources did you find helpful for learning the necessary skills? Any advice on navigating the job search as a career changer?  I'm especially interested in web development roles.

Anyone currently with Visible who can weigh in on their experience, especially regarding data speeds and support? title: First Time Car Buyer - Confused About Financing

I've been pre-approved for a loan through my credit union, but I'm totally overwhelmed by all the financing jargon. APR, loan term, principal... it's a lot!  I'm seeing offers ranging from 4.5% APR for 36 months to 6.8% APR for 72 months. Which is better? Longer loan = lower monthly payments, but more interest overall, right?  I'm also worried about getting ripped off at the dealership. Any advice for a newbie navigating car financing? Should I *only* rely on my credit union's pre-approval, or should I explore dealer financing too?

title: Is it illegal to record a conversation with a landlord without their consent in Florida?
self_text: I’m subletting an apartment in Florida and my landlord has been consistently violating the terms of our lease (entering without notice, refusing to address habitability issues, etc.). I’m documenting everything, and I’m considering secretly recording our conversations to have concrete evidence if I need to pursue legal action. I understand Florida is a “two-party consent” state, but I’ve seen conflicting information about exceptions for landlords. Is it risky to record these conversations, even if it strengthens my case? I'm not planning on sharing recordings publicly, only presenting them to an attorney or in court if necessary.

title: Need help diagnosing intermittent freezing on Macbook Pro (M1, 2021)
self_text: My Macbook Pro (M1, 2021, 16 inch) has started intermittently freezing for 5-10 seconds at a time. It happens seemingly randomly – sometimes while browsing Safari, sometimes while editing photos in Lightroom, occasionally even just sitting on the desktop. There’s no spinning beach ball, the cursor *can* still move, but clicking on anything doesn't register until the freeze ends. Activity Monitor doesn’t show anything maxing out CPU or Memory *during* the freezes (though I haven't been watching it constantly leading up to them). I’ve restarted a few times, cleared caches, and run Disk Utility First Aid, but nothing has resolved it. Anyone experienced this and found a fix? Thinking about reinstalling macOS but hoping to avoid that if possible.

title: Need help identifying a plant!
self_text: Hi everyone! I inherited a plant from a friend who sadly moved away. They weren't sure what it was, and I'm hoping someone here can identify it so I can properly care for it. It has thick, fleshy leaves that are speckled with white, and grows upwards. It hasn't flowered yet. Any ideas? [Image Link](https://i.imgur.com/aBcDeFg.jpg)

title: Should I replace my 10 year old Macbook Pro?
self_text: My 2012 Macbook Pro is starting to struggle. It's a 15 inch model with 16GB of RAM, originally configured with a 512GB SSD (now replaced with a 1TB Crucial MX500). Lately, even basic tasks like browsing with multiple tabs open or running Microsoft Teams for work are causing noticeable slowdowns and beachballing. I've cleaned up the OS, maxed out the RAM, and upgraded the SSD, but the aging processor (Intel Core i7-3820QM) is clearly the bottleneck.  Apple support says repairs are limited given the age of the machine.  I'm considering a new Macbook Pro (probably a 14-inch M2 Pro) but they're *expensive*. Would investing in a newer machine significantly improve my daily workflow and overall computing experience, or am I better off limping along with what I have for another year or two? I mostly do office work, web browsing, and occasionally some light photo editing.

title: Anyone else experiencing constant disconnects on Destiny 2?
self_text: Ever since the Witch Queen expansion launched, I've been consistently disconnecting from Destiny 2 matches. It happens multiple times per Crucible match, and occasionally even in strikes and raids. It's incredibly frustrating, especially during endgame content. I've tried troubleshooting steps like restarting my router, verifying game files, and updating my network drivers, but nothing seems to fix the issue. Others on Reddit and Twitter are reporting similar problems. Is anyone else experiencing this, and has anyone found a solution?

I'm mostly concerned about potential tax implications or disruptions to ongoing investments.

title: What do you do when your roommate steals food?
self_text: Okay, this is awkward. My roommate (male, 22) consistently eats my food. Not like a bite of leftovers, but like, finishes entire containers of things I specifically bought. I label EVERYTHING with my name. I’ve brought it up casually a couple times (“Oh hey, did you enjoy the yogurt? I was planning on having that for breakfast.”), and he acts confused and apologetic, but it *keeps* happening. It’s not a huge financial burden, but it’s incredibly irritating and disrespectful. I’m hesitant to escalate things to a serious confrontation because we otherwise get along okay. What’s the best way to address this without creating major tension? Should I start hiding my food? Is there a passive aggressive tactic that actually works?

title: Question regarding tax implications of selling crypto
self_text: Hi all, I’m relatively new to crypto and am planning to sell some holdings I’ve had for a while. I understand capital gains taxes apply, but I’m confused about how it’s calculated. I originally purchased Bitcoin for $5,000 in 2021, and it’s now worth $15,000. I also purchased Ethereum for $2,000 in 2022, and it’s now worth $1,000 (so a loss). If I sell both simultaneously, how will my capital gains be calculated? Will the loss on the Ethereum offset the gain on the Bitcoin? And what tax bracket will this fall into? I'm located in the US.

title: Anyone else experiencing massive latency spikes with Verizon Fios?
self_text: Lately, my Verizon Fios connection has been incredibly unstable. I consistently get download speeds advertised (around 900 Mbps), but the ping fluctuates wildly – often spiking to 200ms or even higher for short periods. This makes online gaming and even Zoom calls unbearable. I've rebooted my ONT and router multiple times, and the issue persists. I've run traceroutes, and it seems the problem starts *after* my ONT, somewhere within Verizon's network. Has anyone else experienced this recently? Is there anything I can do besides contacting support (who haven't been helpful so far)?

title: Is it worth buying a refurbished Macbook Air M1?
self_text: I'm a student looking for a lightweight laptop for notes, web browsing, and some light coding. I've been eyeing the Macbook Air M1, but I'm hesitant to spend full price. I've found a certified refurbished one from Apple for $799. It comes with a one-year warranty. Is this a good deal? Are there any major downsides to buying a refurbished MacBook Air versus a new one? I'm concerned about battery life or potential hidden issues.

title: First Time Car Buyer - Worried About Getting Ripped Off
self_text: Hey everyone, I'm planning on buying my first car in the next month or so. I've been saving up for a while and have about $8,000 for a down payment. I'm looking at used cars in the $15,000-$20,000 range. I'm really nervous about getting ripped off – I don't know much about cars and I'm afraid I'll get pressured into buying something unreliable or overpriced. Any advice for a first-time buyer? Should I bring a mechanic with me to inspect the car? Are there specific dealerships or websites that are generally more trustworthy? Any tips would be greatly appreciated!

title: Need help diagnosing intermittent crashing - Ryzen 5600X, RTX 3070
self_text: My PC has been intermittently crashing, usually within 30-60 minutes of gaming. There's no consistent pattern – sometimes it's during loading, sometimes in gameplay, sometimes seemingly at idle. The crashes are a full system freeze requiring a hard reboot. I've monitored temperatures and they seem normal (CPU peaking around 75°C, GPU around 70°C). I’ve run Memtest86 overnight with no errors reported. Drivers are up to date. Power supply is 750W Gold rated.  I suspect it might be related to the RAM, but I'm not sure. Specs: Ryzen 5 5600X, RTX 3070, 16GB DDR4 3200MHz CL16, MSI B450 Tomahawk MAX, 750W PSU. Any suggestions on what to troubleshoot next?

title: Anyone else experiencing insane queue times in Ranked?
self_text: Been trying to play ranked all evening and consistently waiting 10-15 minutes for a match. It's getting ridiculous. Saw a post earlier mentioning it might be due to MMR inflation but haven't seen any acknowledgement from Riot. Anyone else running into this?

title: Thinking of switching to Mint Mobile - Worth it?
self_text: Been with Verizon for years and my bill is creeping up to almost $200/month for two lines. Mint Mobile looks attractive with their tiered plans and seemingly cheaper costs. I've read mixed reviews – some say the coverage is excellent, others complain about slower data speeds. We live in a suburban area with generally good cell reception. Does anyone have experience with Mint Mobile and can vouch for its reliability and data speeds? Is it truly a significant cost saver, or are there hidden downsides?

title: Is it worth switching to Visible Wireless?
self_text: I'm currently on Mint Mobile and generally happy with the service, but I've been seeing ads for Visible Wireless claiming great deals. I'm wondering if anyone has made the switch and has feedback on the coverage (I'm in Denver, CO) and overall reliability. Mint is cheaper, but Visible offers hotspot data and potentially faster speeds. Is the trade-off worth it?

title: Is a Costco membership worth it if you live alone?
self_text: I'm a single person living in a relatively small apartment. I generally only buy groceries for myself and don't consume large quantities of anything. I've been considering a Costco membership because I've heard their gas prices are good and occasionally they have deals on electronics, but I'm worried I won't buy enough to offset the $60 annual fee. Does anyone else live solo and find the membership worthwhile? What do you typically buy there?

title: Is it possible to get banned for using scripts to automate tasks in Path of Exile?
self_text: I've been exploring ways to streamline some of the more tedious aspects of Path of Exile, like crafting or farming certain content. I stumbled upon some scripting tools that can automate clicking and repeating actions. While I'm not looking to cheat or gain an unfair advantage (like automating complex combat sequences), I'm concerned about violating the game's Terms of Service simply by automating mundane tasks. Has anyone experienced bans or warnings for using scripts for basic automation in PoE? I'm specifically avoiding anything that impacts gameplay decisions or interacts with the game client in a malicious way.

title: Is it cheaper to buy a new fridge or repair my current one?
self_text: My fridge is about 10 years old and the compressor is failing. Repair quotes are ranging from $800-$1200 (parts and labor). New fridges (similar size and features) are around $1500-$2000. Energy efficiency is also a consideration – my current fridge is significantly less efficient than newer models. What factors should I weigh to determine if repairing is worthwhile, or if I should just replace it? I'm leaning towards replacement but want to explore all options.

title: Thinking of switching careers - Software Engineer to Data Science
self_text: I'm a software engineer with 5 YOE, proficient in Python and SQL, and generally enjoy programming. However, I'm increasingly drawn to data analysis and modeling – I find myself spending a lot of downtime exploring datasets and learning about machine learning concepts. I'm considering a career switch to data science, potentially specializing in ML engineering.  I'm hesitant because I'm comfortable and relatively well-paid in my current role. I'm concerned about the job market volatility in data science, the potential need for further education (Master's degree?), and whether my existing skills translate effectively.  Anyone made a similar leap? Any advice on how to assess the feasibility and prepare for such a transition? What resources would you recommend?

title: Need advice on switching careers - Software Engineer to Data Science
self_text: Hi everyone, I'm a Software Engineer with 3 years of experience, specializing in backend development (Python, Django, PostgreSQL). I'm increasingly drawn to data science – specifically machine learning – and enjoy the analytical aspects of my current role. I've started taking courses on Coursera and Udemy (Andrew Ng's ML course, Python for Data Science and Machine Learning Bootcamp) and enjoy the material. I'm aiming for roles involving model building and deployment. My question is: what's the most effective path to transition? Should I focus on building a strong portfolio of projects (Kaggle, personal projects)? Pursue a Master's degree? Look for internal opportunities within my current company? Any advice on resources, skills to prioritize, or navigating the job search would be greatly appreciated.

title: Question regarding switching from ATT to Verizon
self_text: I’m thinking about switching from ATT to Verizon. I currently have a 5G hotspot that I use for internet because my neighborhood doesn’t have fiber optic capabilities. I’m concerned that Verizon’s 5G coverage isn’t as strong as ATT’s in my area. Does anyone have experience with both providers and can speak to the reliability and speed of their 5G hotspots? I'm located in rural Pennsylvania.

title: Anyone else experiencing massive latency spikes with Comcast Xfinity?
self_text: Lately, I've been consistently experiencing massive latency spikes with my Comcast Xfinity internet. Ping jumps from a stable 20ms to upwards of 200-300ms seemingly at random intervals, lasting for several seconds. This is affecting online gaming and even streaming. I've rebooted my modem and router multiple times, run speed tests (which show consistent download/upload speeds, but don't reflect the latency issue), and contacted support twice – they've run diagnostics remotely and claimed everything looks fine on their end. Anyone else experiencing this? Any troubleshooting steps I haven't tried?

title: Is it worth buying a refurbished Macbook Air M1?
self_text: I'm a college student looking for a lightweight laptop for note-taking, web browsing, and writing papers. I've been eyeing the Macbook Air M1, but I'm hesitant to spend $999 on a new one. I've found certified refurbished ones from Apple for around $799. Are refurbished MacBooks reliable? Are there any downsides to buying one versus new? I'm concerned about battery life and potential hidden issues.

title: Is a mechanical keyboard worth it?
self_text: I’ve been using membrane keyboards my whole life and I’m considering switching to a mechanical keyboard. I’ve heard they’re more durable, responsive, and enjoyable to type on, but they’re also significantly more expensive. I mostly use my computer for general tasks like browsing, writing emails, and occasionally gaming. Is the upgrade worth it for someone like me, or am I better off sticking with a cheaper membrane keyboard?

title: Is it possible to replace a mechanical keyboard switch without desoldering?
self_text: I just got a Keychron Q1 and I love it, but one of the switches is kinda sticky. I’ve watched some videos and it seems like you *usually* have to desolder the switches to replace them, but I'm really hesitant to do that because I don't have a soldering iron and I'm worried about damaging the PCB. Are there any hot-swappable keyboards, or adapters, or tools that allow you to simply pull out a switch and snap in a new one without soldering? I know the Q1 supports switch modifications but I’m not sure if that includes hot swapping.

title: Been ghosted after initial interview - is it normal?
self_text: I had an initial screening interview last Monday for a junior data analyst role. The interviewer said they were impressed and would schedule a technical assessment within a week. It's now been eight days and I haven't heard anything back despite emailing to politely follow up yesterday. Is this typical? I'm trying not to get discouraged, but it's hard not to assume I've been rejected without any communication.

title: Why does my phone keep restarting?
self_text: My Samsung Galaxy S21 keeps restarting seemingly at random. It'll be fine for hours, then just abruptly restart. Doesn't seem to be tied to any specific app or activity. I've cleared the cache partition, but that hasn't solved the issue. Factory reset is a last resort as it's a pain to set everything up again. Any troubleshooting steps I should try before resorting to that?

title: Is it worth switching to Visible Wireless?
self_text: I'm currently with Mint Mobile and my promotional rate expires in a few months. I've been looking at Visible as an alternative, especially since they offer more data than my current plan. I'm concerned about the deprioritization of data and slower speeds, though. Has anyone made the switch recently and experienced noticeable differences in performance? I live in a major city and primarily use my phone for browsing, streaming music, and social media.

title: Is it worth upgrading to a newer iPhone if my 12 Pro is still working well?
self_text: My iPhone 12 Pro is still functioning flawlessly – battery health is at 88%, no cracks, everything works as expected. However, I'm tempted by the 15 Pro Max due to the camera improvements and USB-C. I'm not experiencing any major pain points with my current phone. Is the upgrade truly worthwhile, or am I better off sticking with what I have for another year or two? Considering I use my phone primarily for photos and general daily tasks.

title: Anyone else experiencing major latency spikes with Verizon 5G UW?
self_text: Lately, my 5G Ultra Wideband connection has been incredibly inconsistent. I'm consistently getting download speeds advertised (around 800Mbps), but the latency is spiking wildly – often jumping from 20ms to 100ms+ multiple times per minute. This makes online gaming and even smooth video conferencing nearly impossible. I've tested with multiple devices and speed test sites, and the results are the same. I've contacted Verizon support twice, and they've just run me through the typical troubleshooting steps (resetting my router, checking signal strength) with no improvement. Wondering if others are experiencing similar issues, and if anyone has found a solution? Location is central NJ.

title: Thinking of switching careers...need advice
self_text: Hi everyone! I’m currently a registered nurse with 5 years of experience, but I’m increasingly burnt out and disillusioned with healthcare. I've always enjoyed writing and research, and I’m considering a career change into technical writing or UX writing. I have a bachelor's degree in nursing, but no formal training in writing or design. I'm willing to take courses or bootcamps to gain relevant skills.  What resources would you recommend for breaking into these fields? Are there any certifications that would be helpful? Also, realistically, how long does it typically take to make a successful career transition like this, and what kind of salary expectations should I have starting out? Any advice or insights would be greatly appreciated!

title: Thinking of switching to Mint Mobile - Worth it?
self_text: Been with Verizon for years and my bill is creeping up to $150/month for a single line. Seeing ads for Mint Mobile everywhere promising coverage for $15/month. Sounds too good to be true. Anyone made the switch and have feedback? Worried about coverage reliability since I travel occasionally. Live in suburban Philadelphia.

title: New Monitor Question - Ultrawide vs Dual Monitors
self_text: Okay, I'm finally upgrading my monitor setup. Currently rocking a single 27" 1080p monitor. I'm torn between going ultrawide (34"+) or getting two 27" 1440p monitors. I mostly game (RPG, strategy, some shooters) and do general productivity stuff (coding, browsing, writing). Budget is around $500-$800. Pros/cons I've thought about: Ultrawide: Immersion, seamless gaming, cleaner desk. Cons: Potential for distortion, harder to drive with weaker GPUs. Dual Monitors: More screen real estate, flexibility, potentially cheaper. Cons: Bezels, requires more desk space, can be distracting. Leaning towards ultrawide, but worried about future proofing. Anyone have experience with both setups? Which would *you* recommend for my usage?

title: Can anyone recommend a good mechanical keyboard under $100?
self_text: I'm looking to upgrade from my membrane keyboard to a mechanical one, but I'm on a tight budget. I've been doing some research, but there are so many options it's overwhelming! I mostly use my keyboard for typing and light gaming. I'd prefer something with brown switches or something similar that isn't too loud. Any recommendations for a good mechanical keyboard under $100?

title: Is it worth switching to Visible from Mint Mobile?
self_text: I've been a Mint Mobile customer for about 3 years now and generally happy with the service, but my promotional rate is expiring soon and the price is jumping up significantly. I've been looking at Visible and their plans seem comparable in price, especially with party pay. However, I've heard mixed reviews about Visible's data speeds and customer service. I primarily use my phone for browsing, social media, streaming music, and occasionally watching videos. I rarely download large files. I live in a decently populated suburban area. Has anyone made the switch from Mint to Visible recently? Was it worth it? Are the data speeds noticeably slower?

title: Can I use a USB-C hub with DisplayPort alt mode on a Nintendo Switch dock?
self_text: I’m planning on connecting my Switch to a monitor via a USB-C hub that supports DisplayPort Alt Mode. The hub also has USB ports and an Ethernet port, which would be incredibly convenient. However, I’ve read conflicting reports online about compatibility with the Switch dock. Some sources say it works flawlessly, while others mention issues with signal stability or no output at all. Has anyone successfully used a USB-C hub with DP Alt Mode connected to a Switch dock to connect to an external monitor? If so, which hub did you use, and did you encounter any problems?

title: Question about Costco Executive Membership Worth
self_text: Okay, I’ve been debating getting the Costco Executive membership for a while now. I currently spend roughly $600-800/month at Costco (mostly groceries, gas, and household stuff). I'm wondering if the 2% cashback would actually offset the $120 annual fee. Has anyone crunched the numbers on this? Is it generally worth it if you spend around that amount annually? Any insights would be helpful!

title: New Car Smell Alternatives?
self_text: Okay, I know the “new car smell” is mostly toxic chemicals off-gassing, and I’m trying to avoid that. I just traded in my old car and the new one smells…sterile. I *want* a pleasant scent, but something natural and healthy. I’ve thought about essential oil diffusers, but not sure if that’s practical or safe while driving. Any recommendations for ways to make a new car smell nice *without* relying on synthetic air fresheners? Bamboo charcoal bags? Specific essential oils? Something else entirely?

title: Is it worth upgrading to a newer CPU for streaming?
self_text: I currently have a Ryzen 5 3600 paired with a RTX 3070. I stream on Twitch while gaming, typically Apex Legends or Valorant. I've noticed some stuttering and frame drops occasionally, especially during intense moments. I'm wondering if upgrading my CPU to something like a Ryzen 7 5800X3D would significantly improve my streaming performance, or if the bottleneck is elsewhere (like potentially VRAM?). I'm hesitant to spend the money if it won't make a noticeable difference. Any thoughts?

title: Is it ethical to use ChatGPT to write cover letters?
self_text: I'm applying for jobs right now and I've been experimenting with using ChatGPT to draft cover letters based on the job descriptions. It saves a TON of time, and honestly, it writes pretty good ones. But I feel kinda guilty about it – is it dishonest to submit a cover letter that wasn't entirely written by me? I'm still editing and tailoring them, but the core content often comes from the AI. I'm worried about getting caught, but also about whether it undermines the purpose of a cover letter, which is supposed to showcase *my* writing skills and personality. What do other people think?

title: Is it worth it to replace a failing HDD with an SSD?
self_text: My current PC is getting noticeably slower, especially boot times and loading applications. Upon investigation, it seems my HDD is nearing capacity and showing signs of failure (clicking noises, slow response times). I'm considering replacing it with an SSD, but I'm hesitant because of the cost. Would the performance improvement be significant enough to justify the expense? I mainly use my PC for general tasks like browsing, office work, and some light gaming.

title: Anyone else experiencing massive packet loss with Comcast/Xfinity?
self_text: Lately, I've been getting consistent packet loss – upwards of 20-30% – especially during peak hours. It's impacting online gaming *badly* and even causing Zoom calls to drop. I've rebooted my modem countless times, checked all my connections, and run various tests. Traceroutes show the packet loss starts *immediately* at my local Comcast node. I've contacted support twice, and they've given me the usual runaround ("reset your modem," "there are no outages in your area"). Anyone else experiencing this? Is anyone successfully getting Comcast to acknowledge and fix this?

title: Is it okay to tip on takeout?
self_text: I've been seeing a lot of debate online about whether or not you should tip on takeout orders. I generally tip 15-20% on everything, but I'm starting to wonder if it's expected or necessary for takeout. The employees aren't providing table service, so it feels different than dining in. But I also want to be respectful and support workers. What's the general consensus?

title: Is there a noticeable difference between the Steam Deck OLED and LCD?
self_text: I currently own the original LCD Steam Deck and am considering upgrading to the OLED model. I've watched videos comparing the two, but I'm curious to hear from people who have *actually* made the switch. Is the OLED screen significantly better? Is it worth the ~$200 price increase, especially considering the relatively modest improvements to battery life and Wi-Fi? I primarily play AAA games and indies alike, and portability is important to me.

title: Is anyone else experiencing a weird bug with the new Destiny 2 season pass?
self_text: I purchased the Season of the Seraph season pass, but the seasonal challenges aren’t appearing in the director. I’ve restarted the game multiple times, cleared the cache, and verified game files, but nothing seems to work. I’ve seen a few other people reporting the same issue on Twitter. Anyone else encountering this?
